creator: Thelordbot
title: Máquina CNC (CNC Machine
materials_required: MDF Table(s) of various dimensions (see description for specifics)
description: This project outlines the construction of a CNC (Computer Numerical Control) machine capable of cutting, carving, or creating circuits on various materials based on computer-generated instructions. The machine uses an Arduino Uno with a CNC shield and is adaptable to different types of cutting or drawing tools, including a mototool or pens.
steps: Install Arduino and GRBL: Download and install Arduino software version 1.6.7. Then, download the GRBL library from Github, add it to the Arduino IDE, and upload the GRBLtoArduino example to your Arduino Uno board.

Install and Configure Inkscape: Download and install Inkscape. Open Inkscape, import the image to be vectorized, vectorize the bitmap, and configure the settings. Then, use Gcodetools to add orientation points, select the appropriate tool library (cylinder), adjust the parameters, and generate the G-code.

Install Universal G-Code Sender: Download and install the Universal G-Code Sender software. Ensure you have the latest version of Java installed. Open the downloaded .rar file and transfer the documents to a folder.

Assemble Box for Y Axis: Cut the wood with the specified dimensions, sand, and glue/nail the parts together. Use the 50 cm rails to join the specified parts. Ensure the drawer base slides easily, oiling the rails if needed. Create the table top.

Assemble X, Y, and Z Axis: Assemble the X axis using a screwdriver, screws, and wood glue. Drill holes for electrical installation.  Adhere parts 15 and 16 to the rails of the X axis, then paste the other parts of the Z axis in their respective order. Join the X axis to the Y axis, joining wood 14 with wood 3 and wood 12 with wood 4.

Install Screws and Motors: Install NEMA stepper motors with four-wire screws.  Adjust the motors in the wood and fit the couplings.  Use parts 22 and 23 with a nut in the center each for the displacement of the screw and the metal sheet.
Fit the Springs to the Z Axis: Add tension springs to the Z axis to support the motor. Secure the springs using screws.
Electrical Installation: Calibrate the drivers connected to the shield and Arduino using the appropriate formulas. Connect jumpers cables and set the power supply.
Energy: Cut a part of box Y and install the power source inside the Y-axis box and screw it to the structure.

Assemble Circuit: Connect the drivers to the CNC shield. Position the Arduino and shield within the Y-axis box, securing them with screws. Connect the power supply to the shield.  Attach jumpers to motors and shield.

Connection and Electrical Circuit: Connect the data cable to the Arduino and the computer. Verify all jumpers are connected correctly and the power supply wires are connected to the shield. Connect the power cord to the power source and turn it on. Open the Universal Gcode software on the computer and load the GRBL library.
Base to Place the Brushes, Mototool, and Tool: With a drill open several holes and put the screw supports, then adapt any material for cutting, carving or drawing.
